content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the HOME Program, amending the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to provide downpayment assistance. The Secretary may grant funds to help low-income families achieve homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families are those seeking assistance to acquire a principal residence. The term 'downpayment assistance' refers to aid for eligible low-income families, including first-time homebuyers and uniformed employees, to acquire a principal residence. The downpayment assistance program is for low-income families, including first-time homebuyers and uniformed employees like policemen, firemen, and teachers. The income limitation for the downpayment assistance program is 150 percent of the median income in high-cost areas, as determined by the Secretary. The comprehensive housing affordability strategy must include a description of grant use, targeted outreach to residents of public housing, and actions to ensure the suitability of families receiving downpayment assistance.
